commit_message:
Allow listing of resources and nested resources

This allows the engine to optionally include resources from nested
stacks in a resource-list up to `depth` levels below.  This number is
limited by `max_nested_stack_depth`.

Implements: blueprint explode-nested-resources
Change-Id: I43a5af25e74c7bfb32260f1616d36b311e0f2631

commit_message:
Cleanup and gate on hacking E711 and E712 rule

Fix the offending instances of the rule
and removes it from the ignore list in tox.ini
so that we can gate on E711 and E712 rules.

Most violations were in DB queries. Replace as follows:
  False -> sqlalchemy.sql.false()
  None  -> sqlalchemy.sql.null()
  True  -> sqlalchemy.sql.true()

Change-Id: Id84aa04697d1b3c23dc03195113e296c6715379d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-17 15:50:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/httpclient.py'], 'message': "Only conditionally import working keyring

keyring is conditionally imported if available on your platform,
however not all versions of keyring actually work. Specifically
we have global-requirements of >=2.1,!=3.3, so we know those are
the only versions we believe work.

If you are on an older platform, using system installed
python-keyring, python-keystoneclient won't install a new version,
because it's optional, but then will use a terriblely old verison,
which explodes with dbus errors.

The fix is to be more explicit on import.

Change-Id: I040f7b2311d7d5a450b8b12642752ac519b206fa
Closes-Bug: #1242992
"}]
commit_message:
Only conditionally import working keyring

keyring is conditionally imported if available on your platform,
however not all versions of keyring actually work. Specifically
we have global-requirements of >=2.1,!=3.3, so we know those are
the only versions we believe work.

If you are on an older platform, using system installed
python-keyring, python-keystoneclient won't install a new version,
because it's optional, but then will use a terriblely old verison,
which explodes with dbus errors.

The fix is to be more explicit on import.

Change-Id: I040f7b2311d7d5a450b8b12642752ac519b206fa
Closes-Bug: #1242992

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-18 12:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Initialize RpcProxy objects correctly

RpcProxy class is used as base in classes with multiple inheritance
(ex. MeteringAgent). To initialize objects of such classes correctly
every constructor should call its base constructor via super().__init__()

Closes bug 1332788

Change-Id: I00ef804b6ee6c73dec3e177202bb85311e3e2b10
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize RpcProxy objects correctly

RpcProxy class is used as base in classes with multiple inheritance
(ex. MeteringAgent). To initialize objects of such classes correctly
every constructor should call its base constructor via super().__init__()

Closes bug 1332788

Change-Id: I00ef804b6ee6c73dec3e177202bb85311e3e2b10

commit_message:
Make use of ip route replace in ensure-bridge

Prepending a default route and then deleting the old default route
could be considered an anti-pattern, so replace the code with ip
route replace to change the default route.

Change-Id: I627984d397db7cc2b2db7592b36b142d1da2c7d0

subject: Add --public to setup-endpoints.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-17 19:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/setup-endpoints'], 'message': "Add --public to setup-endpoints.

This allows us the use of HTTP public only endpoints. Until we have
SSL always on, we'll need some way to test VLAN configurations where
the internal network is unreachable, and this supplies such a way.

Change-Id: I8e9ba4ac70f0010ec832bf5a6287bcc3500b030d
"}]
commit_message:
Add --public to setup-endpoints.

This allows us the use of HTTP public only endpoints. Until we have
SSL always on, we'll need some way to test VLAN configurations where
the internal network is unreachable, and this supplies such a way.

Change-Id: I8e9ba4ac70f0010ec832bf5a6287bcc3500b030d

subject: Prevent extra API call when hostname not available
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-21 18:30:52.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/v1/instances.py', 'troveclient/tests/test_instances.py'], 'message': 'Prevent extra API call when hostname not available

Due to recent Trove "list" API call change, hostname/IP is now returned.
So if hostname is not present in object, it is not available at all and
an additional API call should be prevented.

Change-Id: I39f1847e8dd6a5d010cc5d02c3ca09b216e3f627
Closes-Bug: #1341696
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent extra API call when hostname not available

Due to recent Trove "list" API call change, hostname/IP is now returned.
So if hostname is not present in object, it is not available at all and
an additional API call should be prevented.

Change-Id: I39f1847e8dd6a5d010cc5d02c3ca09b216e3f627
Closes-Bug: #1341696

commit_message:
Fix /etc/hosts SELinux file context

/etc/hosts is modified and ends up having the wrong SELinux file
context. Run restorecon to correct it.

Change-Id: I07da602db49b0f122a86a95b5dc5d294fc95ce5c
Closes-Bug: 1344417

OpenStack components installed via source are placed under
/opt/stack/venvs. The files under /opt/stack/venvs/<component>/bin

commit_message:
Correct SELinux file contexts

OpenStack components installed via source are placed under
/opt/stack/venvs. The files under /opt/stack/venvs/<component>/bin
do not have the correct SElinux file contexts. This change
applies the same context as they would have received if they had
been installed by a rpm package under /usr/bin.

Closes-Bug: 1340499
Change-Id: Ibffa1b986b52a1dc28de8d3b8056eed92aae9ee7

commit_message:
Load SELinux policy during image builds

Loading the policy allows commands like setsebool and semanage to
work on the image that is being created.

This allows us to tweak the policy that is embedded in the image.

Change-Id: I03c9ff95436bc603d9f4c442a20538252ab67c17

subject: Call update-rc.d on mysql install for Debian
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-13 06:11:52.000000000', 'files': ['elements/mysql/install.d/10-mysql'], 'message': 'Call update-rc.d on mysql install for Debian

The mysql element installs an init script into /etc/init.d, but
that by itself will not start the service on boot for Debian-like
systems, with the service having to be placed into runlevels, so
run update-rc.d on Debian-like systems.

Change-Id: I50da62692c2f267e78be4c9c19e86e1af1273912
'}]
commit_message:
Call update-rc.d on mysql install for Debian

The mysql element installs an init script into /etc/init.d, but
that by itself will not start the service on boot for Debian-like
systems, with the service having to be placed into runlevels, so
run update-rc.d on Debian-like systems.

Change-Id: I50da62692c2f267e78be4c9c19e86e1af1273912

subject: Update method in host_plugin to find hypervisor by name or id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-18 00:10:30.000000000', 'files': ['climate/tests/plugins/test_physical_host_plugin.py', 'climate/plugins/oshosts/host_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Update method in host_plugin to find hypervisor by name or id

The on_end event for physical reservations was throwing an error as the
host_plugin was trying to find hypervisor/host by name using an ID.

Updated the method to lookup hypervisor from the hypervisor list using
either the name or id. Also updated other references in the code and the
tests.

Change-Id: I6d5a0fea5beeb2e62aad1954591f6e1ced1aceaf
Closes-Bug: 1333342
'}]
commit_message:
Update method in host_plugin to find hypervisor by name or id

The on_end event for physical reservations was throwing an error as the
host_plugin was trying to find hypervisor/host by name using an ID.

Updated the method to lookup hypervisor from the hypervisor list using
either the name or id. Also updated other references in the code and the
tests.

Change-Id: I6d5a0fea5beeb2e62aad1954591f6e1ced1aceaf
Closes-Bug: 1333342

commit_message:
Extracting get group roles for project logic to drivers.

get_group_project_roles is now implemented in each driver.

SQL and LDAP backends will see significant improvements on
performance (less queries made to resolve the groups).

KVS backend now supports inheritance and runs correct unit
tests.

Co-Authored-By: Pablo Fernando Cargnelutti <pablo.fernando.cargnelutti@intel.com>
Change-Id: I7a0190cd4a3b1eb26a09ef6436ca5450cf837135
Closes-Bug: #1205506

commit_message:
Add keystone v3 auth support

This change enables the heat client to use the keystone v3 API (in
addition to v2).  This allows user domains and tenant/project domains to
be specified.  This is necessary because keystone v2 API is deprecated
as of Icehouse.

Change-Id: Id19c4e52b12b379746a36b1f9fb61eb2825c78f3

commit_message:
Remove all 2.7 filtering

ordereddict and importlib used to break when attempted to install
on python 2.7 - but this situation seems to have improved in
modern pip/setuptools. Remove the logic and support for this.

Change-Id: I49d9c9ee3108ad7ec9537f3fcec62e84d4de1680

subject: Stop filtering out argparse
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-21 15:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_setup.py', 'pbr/packaging.py'], 'message': "Stop filtering out argparse

Back in the day, attempting to install argparse on python 2.7 would
result in failure, as the setup.py of argparse failed hard if it was
attempted. That seems to be fixed, and when we do filter it out of
the list now, we cause problems with python 2.6 and wheels (if we make
a wheel on 2.6 and it depends on argparse, the pbr code means that
argparse doesn't get added properly)

Remove the filtering so that our wheels can be universal.

Closes-bug: #1346357
Change-Id: I49d539ac6fb8ee75f8d32fdfbd20129b13d36499
"}]
commit_message:
Stop filtering out argparse

Back in the day, attempting to install argparse on python 2.7 would
result in failure, as the setup.py of argparse failed hard if it was
attempted. That seems to be fixed, and when we do filter it out of
the list now, we cause problems with python 2.6 and wheels (if we make
a wheel on 2.6 and it depends on argparse, the pbr code means that
argparse doesn't get added properly)

Remove the filtering so that our wheels can be universal.

Closes-bug: #1346357
Change-Id: I49d539ac6fb8ee75f8d32fdfbd20129b13d36499

subject: Prevent Messaging to resend failed notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-13 14:07:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests/notifiers/test_messaging.py', 'osprofiler/_notifiers/messaging.py'], 'message': 'Prevent Messaging to resend failed notifications

Infinite retrying to send notification may cause osprofiler to block, if
transport is not configured correctly. So the easiest way to avoid this sort
of blocks is to set retry=0 at notifier configuration.

Change-Id: I5a4b75905dc8d63b612e193805bae28616e425a7
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent Messaging to resend failed notifications

Infinite retrying to send notification may cause osprofiler to block, if
transport is not configured correctly. So the easiest way to avoid this sort
of blocks is to set retry=0 at notifier configuration.

Change-Id: I5a4b75905dc8d63b612e193805bae28616e425a7

commit_message:
Add support for images context semantic validation

This patch adds support for images context semantic validation, it's one
of the series patches for the bp:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/rally/+spec/benchmark-context-semantic-validation.
It just lists images to check whether the image service is available.

Partially Implements: blueprint benchmark-context-semantic-validation

Change-Id: Iecd54dc96110e5ce592478601f3c601e4275768d

feature can be implemented for Storwize driver.

Related blueprint: cinder-storwize-driver-qos

commit_message:
Fix rst formatting and fix tox

This patch does 2 things:
1) it fixes the broken formatting of all of the rst files, so they
   render correctly through sphinx
2) Fix tox so that it runs cleanly against the corrected rst files.

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-07-16 00:52:51.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/tripleo-juno-deploy-cloud-hypervisor-type.rst'], 'message': 'Deploy cloud hypervisor type

Proposes a method for varying the hypervisor type used by Nova in the
deploy cloud to deploy overcloud services from baremetal/ironic to any
other hypervisor type supported by Nova. In particular, containers and
Docker make this deployment attractive due to their lightweight nature.

Change-Id: I7d153b0341e148274590d3d049cf0e2141369e58

commit_message:
Deploy cloud hypervisor type

Proposes a method for varying the hypervisor type used by Nova in the
deploy cloud to deploy overcloud services from baremetal/ironic to any
other hypervisor type supported by Nova. In particular, containers and
Docker make this deployment attractive due to their lightweight nature.

Change-Id: I7d153b0341e148274590d3d049cf0e2141369e58

identity_api).

``keystone.token.core.validate_auth_info`` has been deprecated
with no plans to be superseded as the new ``assert_XXXX_enabled``

This is another step in the process to deprecate the functionality

Change-Id: I450daaca946e9695ff30e058adecef6ef0b9058a
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Consolidate `assert_XXX_enabled` type calls to managers

There are multiple implementations of the various assert_XXX_enabled
methods. These have been consolidated to rely on the appropriate
manager objects (e.g. domain uses assignment_api, user now uses
identity_api).

``keystone.token.core.validate_auth_info`` has been deprecated
with no plans to be superseded as the new ``assert_XXXX_enabled``
methods now cover the functionality.

This is another step in the process to deprecate the functionality
from the token_api (and move relevant logic either the
token provider or other relevant locations).

Change-Id: I450daaca946e9695ff30e058adecef6ef0b9058a
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Mark nodes to error if update was failed

We have to mark all nodes to error explicitly in case of failed cluster
updating. Such behaviour was implemented for regular deploy process
but was mistakenly omitted for the update process.

Please keep in mind, that all nodes are marked as error only in case
Astute didn't sent per-node status information.

Change-Id: I945c96d8fc7a27cb7779894a1f69baaafd096689
Closes-Bug: #1332494

commit_message:
for OVS agent, fix dependency on service

Previously, the declaration for vs_bridge required the service, but if
the service is not enabled it's not declared.  This moves the dependency
inside an if.  See bug #1298146 for the background.

Change-Id: Ic51efb16d4ba0a971178ff648f963c61b2e9fdde
Closes-Bug: #1337733

commit_message:
Cinder .start/.end event notifications

This proposal adds .start and .end event notifications for volume
actions using Oslo messaging. All volume actions such as create,
delete, clone, extend, etc... will emit events to the
notification queue.

blueprint start-end-notifications

Change-Id: I55ca10071e10901a1a40a3f1d123fe3c9966a88c

subject: Prefer identity api V3 over v2 in auth_token
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-18 17:29:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': 'Prefer identity api V3 over v2 in auth_token

This reverses the default order of preference between v2 and v3 to use
v3 by default if both are available.

This is basically making the same change as the recent merge in the
middleware package. As the openstack services are still using this
keystone client middleware, making the corresponding change may need.

Change-Id: I010fb243a5403940127d391c3e3864cdb88aac07
'}]
commit_message:
Prefer identity api V3 over v2 in auth_token

This reverses the default order of preference between v2 and v3 to use
v3 by default if both are available.

This is basically making the same change as the recent merge in the
middleware package. As the openstack services are still using this
keystone client middleware, making the corresponding change may need.

commit_message:
Enable X-Auth-Project flag in HTTP headers

This also enables adding all_projects=true as part of the query string

This will set the "all_tenants" flag in the context, and does a policy
check to ensure the all_tenants is authorised

Closes-Bug: 1319112
Change-Id: Ic8c9a65a61784e0e08fa48961b7d6154d05fb11c

commit_message:
Allow form to stay modal after uploading file

Use JQuery Form Plugin for this purpose (placed in
horizon/static/horizon/lib/jquery). Browsers without XHR file upload
support (most importantly, IE<10) do not support setting custom AJAX
request headers, so form with File Upload field still loses modality
in them.

Change-Id: I163d20eac6a066551fa8ba7496bcc80aa59bf7a5
Closes-Bug: #1158501

commit_message:
Move rabbitmq-server cluster port

The Fedora rabbitmq-server package requires an ephemeral port to be
used. Otherwise the service will fail to start if selinux is in enforcing
mode.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1032595

This patch moves the cluster port from 5535 to 61000. Port 61000 is
also reserved through sysctl by setting it as the value for
ip_local_reserved_ports.

Change-Id: I95a5bd48afea179273044c338d73d9c2dbb884a0

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-21 12:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/tests/test_utils.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/utils.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/engines/docker_engine.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/config.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/tests/test_docker_upgrader.py'], 'message': "Upgrades, try to backup database every script run

We have a problem when user has failed upgrade
and during some time he can run the same upgrade
again, in this case user will have outdated db data

In the patch we create database dump with postfix
N in the name, where N is integer which is unique
for the directory and which we increment each
script run.

Don't fail upgrade script if it was not able
to make database dump and there is database
dump in the directory.

Also we keep only 3 latest dumps.

Change-Id: I9d7eab3a79690e4b4720bc7fc2548b83368e415a
Closes-bug: #1342112
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrades, try to backup database every script run

We have a problem when user has failed upgrade
and during some time he can run the same upgrade
again, in this case user will have outdated db data

In the patch we create database dump with postfix
N in the name, where N is integer which is unique
for the directory and which we increment each
script run.

Don't fail upgrade script if it was not able
to make database dump and there is database
dump in the directory.

Also we keep only 3 latest dumps.

Change-Id: I9d7eab3a79690e4b4720bc7fc2548b83368e415a
Closes-bug: #1342112

commit_message:
Fix heat ostf-test 'test_autoscaling'

-Autoscaling templates were updated
-Verification that second instance is loaded was changed
(before we counted common number of instances with F17 image and waited until
this number increase, but that's not correct, that's why now we count instances which
belong to test stack and wait for scale-up)

Change-Id: I6c7cecf2f38cb73ef05c6eaea2c958e0cebded5b
Closes-Bug: #1334346

commit_message:
Run router dashboard unit tests by default

Currently the "router" dashboard does not have its unit tests
run by default. This was beacuse the dashboard needed to be
turned on for these tests to be run and turning on this dashboard
was not mandatory.

However, now that the dashboards are pluggable, turning on the
router dashboard tests, and more specifically the Cisco N1K profile
tests is doable and necessary. This fix aims to remove the checks
put in place to run the tests only when the dashboard is available
and instead now run all the tests mandatorily

Closes-bug: #1229819

Change-Id: I3c77a71db08ac611e5bdf9274af5a558bfda3327

subject: Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-09 19:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_serializers.py'], 'message': 'Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).

NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).

It makes no sense to raise a constant. The exception should
be raised instead.

Change-Id: I47efa6db2484757022d5f0601719d4ea4c78417d
Closes-Bug: #1339855
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).

NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).

It makes no sense to raise a constant. The exception should
be raised instead.

Change-Id: I47efa6db2484757022d5f0601719d4ea4c78417d
Closes-Bug: #1339855

commit_message:
Separate configuration based on test environment

Added:
- ARTIFACTS variable to store all test artifacts
  under single directory
- yaml config generation based on environment variables
- NAILGUN_CONFIG variable in run_tests.sh and settings.py

Commands used for testing:
  TEST_NAILGUN_DB=nailgun1 ARTIFACTS=/tmp/test_runs/1 \
  UI_SERVER_PORT=8011 FUELCLIENT_SERVER_PORT=8021 ./run_tests.sh

  TEST_NAILGUN_DB=nailgun2 ARTIFACTS=/tmp/test_runs/2 \
  UI_SERVER_PORT=8012 FUELCLIENT_SERVER_PORT=8022 ./run_tests.sh

Change-Id: If03dddee9a8259a80b526a53fe61a79c544c72a4
Closes-Bug: #1282565
Closes-Bug: #1334180

subject: Eager-load Stack.raw_template for Stack.load
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-29 04:20:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/api.py', 'heat/engine/parser.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/engine/watchrule.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Eager-load Stack.raw_template for Stack.load

Whenever a stack is loaded from the database to perform a
parser.Stack.load, the raw_template should be prefetched to
avoid an extra sql query being performed.

However there are many calls to db_api.stack_get which do not need
to access Stack.raw_template, so the default behaviour is to
lazy-load it.

This change reduces the queries for a Stack.load from 3 to 2, so it
contributes to Related-Bug: #1306743

Change-Id: Ie6dad6ea4b1655a99e97a9ac2b7c00018406cd91
'}]
commit_message:
Eager-load Stack.raw_template for Stack.load

Whenever a stack is loaded from the database to perform a
parser.Stack.load, the raw_template should be prefetched to
avoid an extra sql query being performed.

However there are many calls to db_api.stack_get which do not need
to access Stack.raw_template, so the default behaviour is to
lazy-load it.

This change reduces the queries for a Stack.load from 3 to 2, so it
contributes to Related-Bug: #1306743

subject: Fetch all db resources in one query
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-29 04:20:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/parser.py'], 'message': 'Fetch all db resources in one query

Instead of calling resource_get_by_name_and_stack once for every
resource in the stack, db_api.resource_get_all_by_stack is called
only once for all resources.

This reduces the number of sql queries during a describe_stack_resource
call to 3:
1. load the stack
2. load the template
3. load the resources

This is a big improvement over the start of this patch series, which
is 2 queries plus:
* 1 per resource in the stack
* 1 per access to a resource metadata attribute
* 1 per access to a resource data value

There is probably still potential to reduce queries from 3, but this
may well be a fix for
Partial-Bug: 1306743

Change-Id: I80be5d3de8744813d974f2e9860c148ad258f385
'}]
commit_message:
Fetch all db resources in one query

Instead of calling resource_get_by_name_and_stack once for every
resource in the stack, db_api.resource_get_all_by_stack is called
only once for all resources.

This reduces the number of sql queries during a describe_stack_resource
call to 3:
1. load the stack
2. load the template
3. load the resources

This is a big improvement over the start of this patch series, which
is 2 queries plus:
* 1 per resource in the stack
* 1 per access to a resource metadata attribute
* 1 per access to a resource data value

There is probably still potential to reduce queries from 3, but this
may well be a fix for
Partial-Bug: 1306743

Change-Id: I80be5d3de8744813d974f2e9860c148ad258f385

to be a dict keyed by name, instead of a list of resources.

There appear to be zero uses of resource_get_all_by_stack so this

resource_get_by_name_and_stack

Change-Id: I1cc0ea7cf4852cc2407b3ada9ede7b5f6d1cc682

commit_message:
resource_get_all_by_stack returns a dict

This changes the returned results of resource_get_all_by_stack
to be a dict keyed by name, instead of a list of resources.

There appear to be zero uses of resource_get_all_by_stack so this
should have no effect on existing code, but it will be a more useful
form to consume the resources in a stack.

This change also prefetches resource data, as for
resource_get_by_name_and_stack

Change-Id: I1cc0ea7cf4852cc2407b3ada9ede7b5f6d1cc682

commit_message:
Refactor DB resource fetching from Resource to Stack

By moving this database call to the stack, this allows a future
change to adopt a loading strategy which avoids one sql call
per resource.

Change-Id: Ie29edaf3ffc0a332db421ad01edfa7445eb806e5
(manually merged from cherry-pick 9f01b9bc1a69a4843d3c9361cd990104613eed40)

commit_message:
Do not query database for every metadata_get

This change stores the rsrc_metadata locally when the Resource object
is created so that the database is not queried every time
metadata_get is called. There are some instances where the metadata
must come from the database (eg, polling for waitcondition signal) so
an optional refresh arg is added to metadata_get to force a database
refresh of the stored rsrc_metadata.

This results in one less sql query for every time metadata_get is called,
which will help the optimising effort for
Related-Bug: #1306743

Change-Id: Iad2d810c299347ae3b6a4a8329bbd314ee4b5c16

commit_message:
Use resource methods for metadata get/set

The current approach of using the Metadata descriptor
class has some issues including:
* Unintended database queries on accessing a metadata attribute
* get/modify/set patterns since the attribute isn't backed by a real dict
* lack of control over whether to fetch metadata locally or from the db

This change creates Resource methods metadata_get and metadata_set to use
for reading and modifying resource data. This is a refactoring change only so
there should be no change in behaviour.

This change will help in the future with
Related-Bug: #1306743

Change-Id: I7cd87a071ac410a388d787f132c9aee194030714
(manually merged from cherry-pick 96791aaa107b54908e3c7a7531d96f08cb17acd8)

Change-Id: I1107ee9710ec8520d7231c5b8b711e21b4183a34

commit_message:
Do not initialise stack_user password

Since Server implements this property with @property decorators,
setting password to None has the side-effect of writing None to
the resource data.

This change fetches the password with getattr instead.

Change-Id: I1107ee9710ec8520d7231c5b8b711e21b4183a34

subject: Optional data for resource_data_get_all
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-27 22:14:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_api.py'], 'message': 'Optional data for resource_data_get_all

resource_data_get_all queries the database for the data, and
transforms the results to a decrypted dict.

If the data is already loaded then it is unnecessary to do the
database query again.

This change allows data to be passed in as an optional argument.
If the passed data is not None then no database call will be made
and the dict transformation will occur on passed data.

Change-Id: I579225d9a3f3b038e0ca41a5900c58413d6e25ac
Related-Bug: #1306743
'}]
commit_message:
Optional data for resource_data_get_all

resource_data_get_all queries the database for the data, and
transforms the results to a decrypted dict.

If the data is already loaded then it is unnecessary to do the
database query again.

This change allows data to be passed in as an optional argument.
If the passed data is not None then no database call will be made
and the dict transformation will occur on passed data.

Change-Id: I579225d9a3f3b038e0ca41a5900c58413d6e25ac
Related-Bug: #1306743

commit_message:
Move retry of prep_resize to conductor instead of scheduler

Prep_resize in Compute Manager calls back Scheduler prep_resize if
an Exception is raised. There is no sense of calling back the
scheduler, it should call Conductor instead.

Implements blueprint move-prep-resize-to-conductor

Change-Id: I2131843c291f5bd01eb4dbd6c8f36a9218120c19

- In HA setup with vCenter nova-network runs on OpenStack controller
  nodes.  We must be sure that nova-network service has single running
  instance among all controllers, otherwise VMs would see multiple

commit_message:
Disable multi_host for nova-network with vCenter

- In HA setup with vCenter nova-network runs on OpenStack controller
  nodes.  We must be sure that nova-network service has single running
  instance among all controllers, otherwise VMs would see multiple
  gateways/DHCP servers in their network.  By default multi_host is
  enabled in HA mode and nova-network will run on every controller.

Partial implements: blueprint vcenter-hv-full-scale-support

Change-Id: I9cb7e1deaa0e533ce81e5f24159600493b25196f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-21 10:42:18.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/vmware/files/ocf/nova-network'], 'message': "Implement cleanup functionality for nova-network OCF script

* implement nova_network_cleanup() function
* determine network segmentation type that nova-network uses (for now
  only FlatDHCPManager supported)
* depending on IP protocol version flush certain iptables chains
* try 3 times to remove all IP addresses assigned to 'flat_network_bridge'
  (usually called 'br100')
* call nova_network_cleanup() during start, we need to be sure that
  there are no garbage when we start
* call nova_network_cleanup() when nova-network failed in
  nova_network_stop(), we need to stop dnsmasq, flush IP addresses on
  'br100' bridge and iptables rules, so thath VMs would not see two
  gateways/DHCP servers in their network
* call nova_network_cleanup() after successfull service stop
* check that 'ip', 'iptables' and 'ip6tables' binaries are available

Change-Id: I098afe269e55a2809ca230b2d6c3ec60c669cb8c
Partial implements: blueprint vcenter-hv-full-scale-support
"}]
commit_message:
Implement cleanup functionality for nova-network OCF script

* implement nova_network_cleanup() function
* determine network segmentation type that nova-network uses (for now
  only FlatDHCPManager supported)
* depending on IP protocol version flush certain iptables chains
* try 3 times to remove all IP addresses assigned to 'flat_network_bridge'
  (usually called 'br100')
* call nova_network_cleanup() during start, we need to be sure that
  there are no garbage when we start
* call nova_network_cleanup() when nova-network failed in
  nova_network_stop(), we need to stop dnsmasq, flush IP addresses on
  'br100' bridge and iptables rules, so thath VMs would not see two
  gateways/DHCP servers in their network
* call nova_network_cleanup() after successfull service stop
* check that 'ip', 'iptables' and 'ip6tables' binaries are available

Change-Id: I098afe269e55a2809ca230b2d6c3ec60c669cb8c
Partial implements: blueprint vcenter-hv-full-scale-support

subject: Move python-memcached install after venv install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-18 12:48:27.000000000', 'files': ['elements/horizon/install.d/horizon-source-install/100-horizon'], 'message': 'Move python-memcached install after venv install

When not using common-venv the venv will not exist until after the
horizon install.

We also want to rewrite the manifest after changing the contents of
the venv, to track what is installed.

This is not added to the horizon requirements file as it is an
optional requirement based on whether memcached is being used or not.

Change-Id: I37b2c5bd95b6d6b484986b957e2866c2b57a5b4c
Closes-Bug: #1344014
'}]
commit_message:
Move python-memcached install after venv install

When not using common-venv the venv will not exist until after the
horizon install.

We also want to rewrite the manifest after changing the contents of
the venv, to track what is installed.

This is not added to the horizon requirements file as it is an
optional requirement based on whether memcached is being used or not.

Change-Id: I37b2c5bd95b6d6b484986b957e2866c2b57a5b4c
Closes-Bug: #1344014

commit_message:
Use VIF details dictionary to get physical_network

Modify mlnx_direct plug and unplug to retrieve physical_network
from VIF details dictionary if network meta dictionary does not contain
physical_network. This will serve ML2 case following the guidelines to
populate vif_details dictionary with attributes required for port plugging.

Change-Id: I0d97bc875be2fff18087c78accef3ec81c059c4b
Closes-Bug: 1304872

commit_message:
check ephemeral disk format at libvirt before use

Add ephemeral disk format at libvirt. There is no check before
so it will be used directly. This patch adds valid check function
and validate it before eph disk was used in virt layer.

Change-Id: I1934573e79f126e725cef4848b15c11a595161c9
Closes-Bug: #1293880

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-11 13:46:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/basevolumeutils.py'], 'message': "Fixes hyper-v volume attach when host is AD member

The domain name gets added to the initiator name used by the host
if it's an Active Directory member.

Currently the method which gets the initiator name does not take
this into account when retrieving the default initiator name.

Trying to use a wrong initiator name will lead to an exception when
trying to log in to the according iSCSI target.

This patch simply appends the domain name (when the host is an AD
member) to the initiator name used to log in to iSCSI targets.

Closes-Bug: #1328870

Change-Id: Ifbe762c685e46081059a01043431b2c4ac5473fc
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes hyper-v volume attach when host is AD member

The domain name gets added to the initiator name used by the host
if it's an Active Directory member.

Currently the method which gets the initiator name does not take
this into account when retrieving the default initiator name.

Trying to use a wrong initiator name will lead to an exception when
trying to log in to the according iSCSI target.

This patch simply appends the domain name (when the host is an AD
member) to the initiator name used to log in to iSCSI targets.

Closes-Bug: #1328870

Change-Id: Ifbe762c685e46081059a01043431b2c4ac5473fc

subject: Handle tcp requests correctly in mdns
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-18 20:00:28.000000000', 'files': ['designate/mdns/service.py'], 'message': 'Handle tcp requests correctly in mdns

Tcp requests have an additional length field before the payload.  This
is not the case with udp requests.  In addition, tcp responses also
need to have the length field at the start of the response.

For now we handle only one packet tcp requests.

Change-Id: Iaf0e45c02a3a6bf627eb6a5dd7aa21f401d6ceef
Closes-Bug: 1344131
'}]
commit_message:
Handle tcp requests correctly in mdns

Tcp requests have an additional length field before the payload.  This
is not the case with udp requests.  In addition, tcp responses also
need to have the length field at the start of the response.

For now we handle only one packet tcp requests.

Change-Id: Iaf0e45c02a3a6bf627eb6a5dd7aa21f401d6ceef
Closes-Bug: 1344131

commit_message:
Adds option to select a different subnet when adding 'vip'

With this fix, 'AddVip' from the dashboard gives user an
option to select a different subnet than the 'pool' subnet
and then creates a 'vip' with an ip (provided/next available)
from the selected subnet.

Change-Id: I25f36090c5fb739256b62a88915f6414e39a915f
Closes-Bug: #1285504

commit_message:
Add create and update times for trove components

Currently trove doesn't show created and updated
timestamps on databases and backups - this is
inconsistent with other dashboard components such
as compute and images

Add created and updated timestamps to details
page of databases and backups.
Backups was already display a 'Created At'
timestamp so also made the wording and formatting
of this consistent

Change-Id: Ia6011db3693471602328e6d471ca2064e882354d
Closes-Bug: #1336865

commit_message:
Add APIv3 support to make host optional on evacuate.

DocImpact: The evacuate target host is now optional. If
'host' field is not sent in the request, the scheduler
will determine the target host. This will include
nova client changes ( on the proper commit ) to support
this new optional parameter.

Implements: blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance

Change-Id: I907ea4ef39cfad50a48cb80bceba217fdf482f6e
Co-Authored-By: Juan M. Olle <juan.m.olle@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andres Buraschi <andres.buraschi@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anuj Mathur <anujm@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Navneet Kumar <navneetk@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claxton Correya <claxton@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow create volume group with block devices for lvm

Add new attribute, create_colume_group_type to allow
either create simple test volume based upon a file
(as existing support does),
or create volume group based upon block devices.

Change-Id: Ia81354f9fab9310c1b5e633d4ca05e434f9c2da6
Closes-Bug: #1321336

commit_message:
IPMINative set_boot_device persistent

The IPMINative driver was ignoring the 'persistent' argument passed to
the _set_boot_device(). Passing the 'persistent' parameter to the
set_bootdev() function is supported by pyghmi.

Change-Id: Idf3b3bed44fc6c537f75c631115e708d3355fef6

subject: Fix service subnet capacity within service_instance module
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-19 19:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/service_instance.py', 'manila/tests/test_service_instance.py'], 'message': "Fix service subnet capacity within service_instance module

Module 'service_instance' creates service_subnet per neutron_subnet,
current mask is 29, that allows take only 3 (three) ips for service
instances. Changed mask to 28, that allows take 11 (eleven) ips now
by default.
It allows us to use multibackend installation with drivers, that
depend on this module more reliably and provides possibility to
change this value in general.

Changes:
- added config option for network subnets mask with default value 28,
  instead of hardcoded 29.
- fixed related unittests

Change-Id: Ib58048832287a9f184317d2c92f0cc22e7f2a303
Closes-Bug: #1341711
Related-Bug: #1330391
"}]
commit_message:
Fix service subnet capacity within service_instance module

Module 'service_instance' creates service_subnet per neutron_subnet,
current mask is 29, that allows take only 3 (three) ips for service
instances. Changed mask to 28, that allows take 11 (eleven) ips now
by default.
It allows us to use multibackend installation with drivers, that
depend on this module more reliably and provides possibility to
change this value in general.

Changes:
- added config option for network subnets mask with default value 28,
  instead of hardcoded 29.
- fixed related unittests

Change-Id: Ib58048832287a9f184317d2c92f0cc22e7f2a303
Closes-Bug: #1341711
Related-Bug: #1330391

subject: Fix metaclasses assignment
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-17 17:36:59.000000000', 'files': ['manila/network/linux/interface.py', 'manila/tests/test_manager.py', 'manila/manager.py', 'manila/tests/network/linux/test_interface.py'], 'message': "Fix metaclasses assignment

'metaclass' with 'six' module should be added only using decorator for 'target'-class,
instead of attr assignment else 'target'-class won't see our custom metaclass.

this is fix after merged following commit:
https://github.com/stackforge/manila/commit/8c1a574de3e2e1b0da5f8ffa509284c84ca03264

Also added basic unittests.

Change-Id: I27cdddf32ec81c72a5f71ce8dca04f643a425b67
Closes-Bug: #1343207
"}]
commit_message:
Fix metaclasses assignment

'metaclass' with 'six' module should be added only using decorator for 'target'-class,
instead of attr assignment else 'target'-class won't see our custom metaclass.

this is fix after merged following commit:
https://github.com/stackforge/manila/commit/8c1a574de3e2e1b0da5f8ffa509284c84ca03264

Also added basic unittests.

Change-Id: I27cdddf32ec81c72a5f71ce8dca04f643a425b67
Closes-Bug: #1343207

commit_message:
stunnel: Allow CA certificate to be specified

Allow a CA certificate to be specified in addition to a key and cert,
and automatically add it to the default system CA bundle.

This is required for sites which use their own Certificate Authority.

Partially implements: blueprint tripleo-ssl-overcloud

Full set of blueprint changes:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85098
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85099
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85100

Change-Id: Iaa5da8b1d9ffe72ae3959b7d3be4fb9b25c2f46e

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-07-04 15:04:15.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/ironic-snmp-power-driver.rst'], 'message': 'Power driver for SNMP-enabled smart PDUs

A mechanism for remote control of node power by enabling or disabling
sockets on a rack power strip. The result will be a much wider
generalisation of the hardware that can be controlled by Ironic.

Change-Id: Ib16781eaa9737525c4d8a9231ecd9e72d7e2645e

commit_message:
Power driver for SNMP-enabled smart PDUs

A mechanism for remote control of node power by enabling or disabling
sockets on a rack power strip. The result will be a much wider
generalisation of the hardware that can be controlled by Ironic.

Change-Id: Ib16781eaa9737525c4d8a9231ecd9e72d7e2645e

commit_message:
Basic stunnel firewall configuration

Currently when using stunnel to terminate services using SSL (https) the
original http ports are still available to 'external' nodes.

Here we configure some basic firewall settings to disallow 'external'
connections to the services' http ports.

For now we allow connection from the nova compute nodes to the services'
http ports as using https for those connections is not there yet.

Change-Id: I017d70909d0462584ffc7b2e5ba27be765d78f18

subject: Add nova_compute_ips to overcloud-source.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-18 15:45:30.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-source.yaml'], 'message': "Add nova_compute_ips to overcloud-source.yaml

Currently the nova compute nodes use http connections to the Glance,
Keystone, Neutron APIs.

If we firewall off non-local http connections to the controller node
connections from nova compute will fail.

We add a list of nova compute nodes' IPs. This list can be used by
iptables to allow connections from the nova compute nodes to the http
service ports.

This allows firewalling off all other external connections to non-SSL
ports.

Change-Id: I45611ba4307fa7b56c37d8fb7703d050e60fb92f
"}]
commit_message:
Add nova_compute_ips to overcloud-source.yaml

Currently the nova compute nodes use http connections to the Glance,
Keystone, Neutron APIs.

If we firewall off non-local http connections to the controller node
connections from nova compute will fail.

We add a list of nova compute nodes' IPs. This list can be used by
iptables to allow connections from the nova compute nodes to the http
service ports.

This allows firewalling off all other external connections to non-SSL
ports.

Change-Id: I45611ba4307fa7b56c37d8fb7703d050e60fb92f

commit_message:
Add support for a neutron-based install

Update the trove-integration scripts to be able to install and
configure trove based on Neutron instead of Nova-network.

Co-authored by: Anna Shen <ruiyuan.shen@hp.com>

Partially-implements bp: neutron-support
Change-Id: Iec4773802034c42ddaeaa3c2f2c7cf4af3ee93ee

kwargs, which are transmitted to HttpError in OpenStack clients, differs
with kwargs in HttpError from common code. HttpError should accept **kwargs,

Change-Id: I720bfa0bb1b41a3d3ba4c4b00edd2c33bdaf165a

commit_message:
Add kwargs to HttpError in apiclient.exceptions

kwargs, which are transmitted to HttpError in OpenStack clients, differs
with kwargs in HttpError from common code. HttpError should accept **kwargs,
which should help to provide backwards compatibility with original
exceptions in clients.

Change-Id: I720bfa0bb1b41a3d3ba4c4b00edd2c33bdaf165a

subject: Don't drop pre-existing database before tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10294, 'name': 'Brocade VDX CI', 'email': 'openstack_gerrit@brocade.com', 'username': 'bci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11279, 'name': 'Angus Lees', 'email': 'gus@inodes.org', 'username': 'gus'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-07-21 02:28:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/provision.py'], 'message': 'Don't drop pre-existing database before tests

1. The database name is a random string, so shouldn't already exist.
2. If it *does* already exist, we quite likely want to throw an error
   rather than just delete it.
3. "drop database if exists non_existant_database" throws an error with
   mysqlconnector and a noisy-but-harmless warning with others.

(We could fix (3), if it was important)

For consistency, this also makes drop_database raise an error if the
database doesn't exist (or has been already deleted).

Closes-Bug: #1341906
Change-Id: I0c4a460088ffb7eb79cbf8594d2ff37fd70cf157
'}]
commit_message:
Don't drop pre-existing database before tests

1. The database name is a random string, so shouldn't already exist.
2. If it *does* already exist, we quite likely want to throw an error
   rather than just delete it.
3. "drop database if exists non_existant_database" throws an error with
   mysqlconnector and a noisy-but-harmless warning with others.

(We could fix (3), if it was important)

For consistency, this also makes drop_database raise an error if the
database doesn't exist (or has been already deleted).

Closes-Bug: #1341906
Change-Id: I0c4a460088ffb7eb79cbf8594d2ff37fd70cf157

Replace @_wrap_db_error() with an event-based system

The internal logic of @_wrap_db_error() is replaced by a

Change-Id: Ib8c7f8d5c6f44c49a53dd6411adbf8aaaecb74be

commit_message:
Implement new exception interception and filtering layer

Replace @_wrap_db_error() with an event-based system
that leverages the new SQLAlchemy handle_error() event.

The internal logic of @_wrap_db_error() is replaced by a
system of declarative filters, which is also expressed
on the testing side using a new test framework for these
conditions.

partially implement bp: use-events-for-error-wrapping
Closes-Bug: #1214341
Change-Id: Ib8c7f8d5c6f44c49a53dd6411adbf8aaaecb74be

subject: Implement the SQLAlchemy ``handle_error()`` event.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 7536, 'name': 'Ilya Pekelny', 'email': 'ipekelny@mirantis.com', 'username': 'I159'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'display_name': 'Mike Bayer', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek', 'status': 'Red Hat'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-07-19 17:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/__init__.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/handle_error.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/utils.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_handle_error.py'], 'message': 'Implement the SQLAlchemy ``handle_error()`` event.

This event hook is to be released as of SQLAlchemy 0.9.7, and
supersedes the existing SQLAlchemy ``dbapi_error()`` event, which
is called upon interception of all DBAPI errors and other exceptions
that are raised within core Engine operations.  The new event offers
the ability to intercept all errors associated with statement execution
and result reception, not just DBAPI-level errors, and also supports
re-raising of the given exception with a replacement exception.

Here, we implement a compatible system that works in SQLAlchemy 0.8
and forward.

partially implement bp: use-events-for-error-wrapping
Change-Id: Ife52be4ae870739dc296742fa4aefb3e31c36be4
'}]
commit_message:
Implement the SQLAlchemy ``handle_error()`` event.

This event hook is to be released as of SQLAlchemy 0.9.7, and
supersedes the existing SQLAlchemy ``dbapi_error()`` event, which
is called upon interception of all DBAPI errors and other exceptions
that are raised within core Engine operations.  The new event offers
the ability to intercept all errors associated with statement execution
and result reception, not just DBAPI-level errors, and also supports
re-raising of the given exception with a replacement exception.

Here, we implement a compatible system that works in SQLAlchemy 0.8
and forward.

partially implement bp: use-events-for-error-wrapping
Change-Id: Ife52be4ae870739dc296742fa4aefb3e31c36be4

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-07-17 11:15:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_configdrive.py'], 'message': "VMware: Convert vmops to use instance as an object

This is mostly mechanical, but it does expose what appears to be a bug
in the interaction between object.Instance's config_drive field and
configdrive.required_by(). object.Instance defines config_drive to be
a String, but configdrive.required_by() expects it to be a Boolean. In
assigning a boolean value to config_drive, it is cast to a String,
which evaluates as True when cast back to a Boolean. We therefore
update the tests which use config_drive to set either a String value,
or None, which is what other code does.

Note that Nova does not pass an Instance object to all driver methods,
so not all uses can be updated.

Change-Id: Ifc9ce5d96da30abfa09b608a9c8615ede1485a50
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Convert vmops to use instance as an object

This is mostly mechanical, but it does expose what appears to be a bug
in the interaction between object.Instance's config_drive field and
configdrive.required_by(). object.Instance defines config_drive to be
a String, but configdrive.required_by() expects it to be a Boolean. In
assigning a boolean value to config_drive, it is cast to a String,
which evaluates as True when cast back to a Boolean. We therefore
update the tests which use config_drive to set either a String value,
or None, which is what other code does.

Note that Nova does not pass an Instance object to all driver methods,
so not all uses can be updated.

Change-Id: Ifc9ce5d96da30abfa09b608a9c8615ede1485a50

commit_message:
Add supported file system type check at virt layer

Currently nova doesn't check whether the file system type is supported
by virt layer(hypervisor) before use it. This patch adds current
support file system type definition then create a default check
function at virt layer. Following patches will do the real check
in different driver such as libvirt.

Change-Id: Ie4d876a48b36c1a53b171dd521bdeef868a31486
Partial-Bug: #1293880

Eventlet's Timeout was subclass of Exception. But at some point it
switched to BaseException. Now statements like

do not catch it. Wrapping Timeout into our own one fixes this.

Change-Id: I90bf3b2335359e1f7f4c376e0e7292f18c75f162

commit_message:
Wrap eventlet's Timeout exception

Eventlet's Timeout was subclass of Exception. But at some point it
switched to BaseException. Now statements like

  except Exception as e:

do not catch it. Wrapping Timeout into our own one fixes this.

Change-Id: I90bf3b2335359e1f7f4c376e0e7292f18c75f162

commit_message:
Extend status_description column in Clusters tables

Convert column type to
 * Text for psql - unlimited size
 * LongText for mysql - max size 2^32

Also fixed template for autogenerated migrations: added a blank line to
avoid pep8 violation.

Closes-Bug: #1338933
Change-Id: Ie4c4f57aeb7ff03aa7f6077629f6463a136f8f4b

commit_message:
Always run sysctl through sudo

Some distros (Debian) don't put sbin in PATH for regular users.

To avoid rootwrap overhead in common cases, a best-effort attempt at
running /sbin/sysctl (without sudo) is tried first to see if the option
is already enabled.

Change-Id: I2466cf5d8fafb441e0594f20c148dcf6a764368d
Closes-Bug: #1300800

commit_message:
Update port binding when unshelve instance

When unshelve instance, it should update the attached port also.
This patch invoke network_api.migrate_instance_finish to update
the port's binding info.

Change-Id: Iaa77163dde5494154d67ef392142669d70c3e643
Closes-Bug: #1306922

revisions:
[{'number': 31, 'created': '2014-07-17 22:51:10.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/strategies/restore/couchbase_impl.py', 'etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample', 'trove/common/cfg.py', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/backup/couchbase_impl.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_couchbase_manager.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_backupagent.py', 'trove/guestagent/backup/backupagent.py', 'trove/guestagent/dbaas.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/couchbase/manager.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/couchbase/system.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_backups.py'], 'message': 'Add Backup/Restore support for Couchbase

Backup strategy:
- Save bucket metadata config (as json file) to /tmp/backups
- This is needed on restore to create the destination buckets
- Handles root enabled case by also saving /etc/couchbase/secret_key to /tmp/backups
- Use cbbackup to do the backup
- /tmp/backups will be zipped up, encrypted, and sent to Swift

Restore strategy:
- If /tmp/backups/secret_key exists, set root password
- Iterate through bucket metadata config (json file) and use Couchbase
  REST API to create each bucket
- Wait until bucket finishes creating
- Use cbrestore (which requires destination buckets to be manually
  created first) to do the restore
- cbrestore can only restore one bucket at a time

DocImpact
backup_namespace and restore_namespace were in the default conf group, now they are per datastore

Change-Id: Iaf4370dcc978df68e7d01c6f63795eaf50aac89d
Implements: blueprint backups-single-instance-couchbase
'}]
commit_message:
Add Backup/Restore support for Couchbase

Backup strategy:
- Save bucket metadata config (as json file) to /tmp/backups
- This is needed on restore to create the destination buckets
- Handles root enabled case by also saving /etc/couchbase/secret_key to /tmp/backups
- Use cbbackup to do the backup
- /tmp/backups will be zipped up, encrypted, and sent to Swift

Restore strategy:
- If /tmp/backups/secret_key exists, set root password
- Iterate through bucket metadata config (json file) and use Couchbase
  REST API to create each bucket
- Wait until bucket finishes creating
- Use cbrestore (which requires destination buckets to be manually
  created first) to do the restore
- cbrestore can only restore one bucket at a time

DocImpact
backup_namespace and restore_namespace were in the default conf group, now they are per datastore

Change-Id: Iaf4370dcc978df68e7d01c6f63795eaf50aac89d
Implements: blueprint backups-single-instance-couchbase

commit_message:
Add partial specs support in ML2 for vlan provider networks

ML2 provider networks partial specs let admins choose some provider
network attributes and let neutron choose remaining attributes. This
change provides the implementation for VLAN provider networks.

In practice, for VLAN provider networks provider:physical_network
and provider:segmentation_id choices can be delegated to neutron,
in such case neutron will try to find a network in tenant network
pools which respects provided provider attributes.

DocImpact

Related to blueprint provider-network-partial-specs
Partial-Bug: #1330562

Change-Id: I2c52c71167edaa153b2e04681273e2f1be8d03aa

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-07-19 22:08:20.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/neutron-dvr-fwaas.rst'], 'message': 'Specification for FWaaS changes for DVR

Spec addresses the changes required for FWaaS to work with
DVR to handle:
* Perimeter Firewall support on N - S traffic
* Ensure that E - W DVR traffic is not broken

'}]
commit_message:
Specification for FWaaS changes for DVR

Spec addresses the changes required for FWaaS to work with
DVR to handle:
* Perimeter Firewall support on N - S traffic
* Ensure that E - W DVR traffic is not broken

Implements: blueprint neutron-dvr-fwaas

Change-Id: I2ea7e39b03655cf8ff5fe533b50c5d33ade6720f

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-07-17 17:31:27.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/lp-cedarish/docker/unittest-app', 'contrib/lp-cedarish/docker/app-common', 'contrib/lp-cedarish/docker/build-app'], 'message': 'Refactoring build-app and unittest-app

Created app-common
Replaced with tlog function with TLOG
Added elapsed function, replaced print_end_timestamp
Replaced get_image_id with app_glance_id
Replaced run_timed_command with PRUN
Removed use of EXIT_STATUS
Replaced argument -z tests with $# test
Prepended docker unittest with PRUN
Removed commented code and other cleanup

Change-Id: Ibd9374524541c49d20625d58db1c005351d79c8f
'}]
commit_message:
Refactoring build-app and unittest-app

Created app-common
Replaced with tlog function with TLOG
Added elapsed function, replaced print_end_timestamp
Replaced get_image_id with app_glance_id
Replaced run_timed_command with PRUN
Removed use of EXIT_STATUS
Replaced argument -z tests with $# test
Prepended docker unittest with PRUN
Removed commented code and other cleanup

Change-Id: Ibd9374524541c49d20625d58db1c005351d79c8f

commit_message:
Add argparse for RHEL6

python2.6 doesn't have argparse, required by outfilter.py.  This
package is a dependency on cloud-init, so this problem is often masked
in many testing environments.

Change-Id: Ia564f1b8a7b540faa7bbdbd1a1a290c591901682

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-02 23:01:28.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/cisco-policy-profile-visibility.rst'], 'message': 'Config option to control visibility of cisco-policy-profile

Currently, cisco-policy-profile resources must be explicitly assigned to tenants.
This blueprint proposes adding a config option to Cisco N1KV plugin to control the
visibility of these resources.

The options may be True/False.
Selecting True would allow tenants access to all the cisco-policy-profile resources
without the need for explicit assignment.
The False option would require explicit assignment of a cisco-policy-profile resources
to a tenant.
Default value is True.

Change-Id: Id69023e46960a48bc6f223d7522980df66842e0f
'}]
commit_message:
Config option to control visibility of cisco-policy-profile

Currently, cisco-policy-profile resources must be explicitly assigned to tenants.
This blueprint proposes adding a config option to Cisco N1KV plugin to control the
visibility of these resources.

The options may be True/False.
Selecting True would allow tenants access to all the cisco-policy-profile resources
without the need for explicit assignment.
The False option would require explicit assignment of a cisco-policy-profile resources
to a tenant.
Default value is True.

Change-Id: Id69023e46960a48bc6f223d7522980df66842e0f

or on the Openstack wiki.

'}]
commit_message:
Precise-->Trusty patches for several guides

As Juno will not be supported on Ubuntu 12.04 Precise,
this patch changes all references to 14.04 Trusty, which will
support the next 4 releases.
Updated section_ubuntu_example.xml for consistency.

Change-Id: Ib52513db38b17240026e6a278e8c97c0438358ec

commit_message:
Move cli generated files out of common

There's no shared usage for these files, so move them into a
subdirectory of cli-reference.

Call the subdirectory generated and add a README so that it's clear that
these are generated files.

Fix also .gitignore to only ignore some top-level directories.

Change-Id: Ifb455a8640cc7e735ed81563b438d68522e73ded

VMware: use datastore classes in file_move/delete/exists, mkdir

Straightforward conversion of a few functions in ds_util to
accepts DatastorePath objects instead of literal strings.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

In an effort to do small changes (to keep them mergable and reviewable)
I'm only splitting out the resource browser stuff.  I'm trying to
balance the style that Maxime has used throughout the previous reviews

Partially-Implements: blueprint css-breakdown

commit_message:
Breakdown CSS: split out the resource browser

Now that everything has been converted to scss, splitting out the
individual components of our CSS can and should begin!

In an effort to do small changes (to keep them mergable and reviewable)
I'm only splitting out the resource browser stuff.  I'm trying to
balance the style that Maxime has used throughout the previous reviews
relating to this blueprint while also not changing everything that can
be changed.

Change-Id: Ibc9fb11163883498384e963210067e9600fbca9d
Partially-Implements: blueprint css-breakdown

commit_message:
Revert "Add missing image to instance booted from volume"

This reverts commit c3191cf0ba5ad3dc2df8da2a2bf5c9d270fde9d9.

The change needs to be thought out some more, i.e. why isn't
compute_api.get_all just loading up the image_ref value on the instance
object rather than calling a helper method from the servers extension to
the instance object which just calls back to compute_api, seems very
roundabout, plus isn't it a v3 API issue also?

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py

Due to: 826aed0 Use oslo.i18n

Change-Id: I6abbfdfa786c3d98065c969e7f9d7d5830caf7e8
Closes-Bug: #1343689

revisions:
[{'number': 67, 'created': '2014-05-26 16:17:26.000000000', 'files': ['glance/store/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_swift_store_utils.py', 'glance/common/exception.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/common/swift_store_utils.py', 'glance/store/swift.py', 'doc/source/configuring.rst', 'glance/store/base.py', 'etc/glance-swift.conf.sample', 'glance/tests/unit/test_store_location.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py', 'glance/tests/etc/glance-swift.conf'], 'message': "Remove user and key from location in swift

The image locations table stores the swift url for images
which includes the user and key values. This if exposed,
can cause security risk. Hence this patch, santizies
that information out of the location before storing
and plugs it back in when it is required.
Introduced a new configuration file that supports
multiple swift account references. It has the credentials and
authurl for each store.  It is specified using
'swift_store_config_file'.
In addition, this patch does the following things:

Differentiate user and system created swift location

Currently we do not differentiate between user created
locations and system created locations that have the account
reference. This patch introduces new scheme:
'swift+config' for this purpose.

Image create in V1 should validate the uri

This patch ensures that a store is not set while
creating an image or updating it.

Related to bp remove-sensitive-data-from-locations
Implements blueprint: support-multiple-swift-backends
Implements bp: v1-image-create-should-validate-the-location-uri
DocImpact

Change-Id: If56335a719e6b72876375f797cc47fbd271091be
"}]
commit_message:
Remove user and key from location in swift

The image locations table stores the swift url for images
which includes the user and key values. This if exposed,
can cause security risk. Hence this patch, santizies
that information out of the location before storing
and plugs it back in when it is required.
Introduced a new configuration file that supports
multiple swift account references. It has the credentials and
authurl for each store.  It is specified using
'swift_store_config_file'.
In addition, this patch does the following things:

Differentiate user and system created swift location

Currently we do not differentiate between user created
locations and system created locations that have the account
reference. This patch introduces new scheme:
'swift+config' for this purpose.

Image create in V1 should validate the uri

This patch ensures that a store is not set while
creating an image or updating it.

Related to bp remove-sensitive-data-from-locations
Implements blueprint: support-multiple-swift-backends
Implements bp: v1-image-create-should-validate-the-location-uri
DocImpact

Change-Id: If56335a719e6b72876375f797cc47fbd271091be

This commit introduces loadbalancer instance into LBaaS API,
object model, driver interface, unit tests.
The purpose of LB instance:
1) envelope other main balancer resources such as vips and pools
That is needed to retain loadbalancer configuration as a tree
instead of a graph when multiple pools-vips relationship is
introduced. So Loadbalancer object becomes the root of the tree
instead of the Pool
2) Provide clear boundaries for loadbalancer configuration.
All objects that belong to one loadbalancer are deployed to one
device or agent and are handled with the same provider (driver)
3) Loadbalancer object becomes a 'mounting point' of attributes
associated with configuration such as provider, device, agent,
router.

The patch contains the following changes:
 - CRUD operations for loadbalancer resource
 - Autocreation of loadbalancer resource with the pool
 - Autodeletion of loadbalancer resource with vip or pool deletion
 (needed for API compatibility)
 - Corresponding changes in the driver API

Other changes:
 - provider attribute has moved to loadbalancer resource from the pool.
 E.g. provider attribute in the Pool object is deprecated, but returned
 for backward compatibility.
 - NiciraServicePlugin was fixed in order to preserve backward
compatibility of LBaaS API of Nicira Plugin

implements blueprint lbaas-service-instance
DocImpact
Change-Id: I2bcd98002ad359c713ba128cebe9125767ae88f8
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce Loadbalancer instance

This commit introduces loadbalancer instance into LBaaS API,
object model, driver interface, unit tests.
The purpose of LB instance:
1) envelope other main balancer resources such as vips and pools
That is needed to retain loadbalancer configuration as a tree
instead of a graph when multiple pools-vips relationship is
introduced. So Loadbalancer object becomes the root of the tree
instead of the Pool
2) Provide clear boundaries for loadbalancer configuration.
All objects that belong to one loadbalancer are deployed to one
device or agent and are handled with the same provider (driver)
3) Loadbalancer object becomes a 'mounting point' of attributes
associated with configuration such as provider, device, agent,
router.

The patch contains the following changes:
 - CRUD operations for loadbalancer resource
 - Autocreation of loadbalancer resource with the pool
 - Autodeletion of loadbalancer resource with vip or pool deletion
 (needed for API compatibility)
 - Corresponding changes in the driver API

Other changes:
 - provider attribute has moved to loadbalancer resource from the pool.
 E.g. provider attribute in the Pool object is deprecated, but returned
 for backward compatibility.
 - NiciraServicePlugin was fixed in order to preserve backward
compatibility of LBaaS API of Nicira Plugin

implements blueprint lbaas-service-instance
DocImpact
Change-Id: I2bcd98002ad359c713ba128cebe9125767ae88f8

commit_message:
vmware: VM diagnostics (v3 API only)

There is no formal definition for the VM diagnostics. For the
V2 API the diagnostics will be returned as they are today.

This will support backward compatibility with the existing API's.

Part of the blueprint v3-diagnostics

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6465ee6fc2edac0107e260297d9647c8a16b09ae

subject: Handle null JSON blobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-16 15:53:26.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/api/v1/test_environments.py', 'murano/tests/db/test_models.py', 'murano/db/models.py', 'murano/tests/api/base.py', 'murano/tests/api/v1/test_catalog.py'], 'message': "Handle null JSON blobs

The JSON deserializer doesn't handle null values properly; it raises
a TypeError because it expects a string or buffer. This became apparent
after the supplier info update which added columns that would be null
for existing packages. Patch returns None from the JSON deserializer
in that case, and also refactors unittest base classes.

Change-Id: I6f31500d2dd1aaaf6a1fd26c1901666072d79776
Closes-Bug: #1342306
"}]
commit_message:
Handle null JSON blobs

The JSON deserializer doesn't handle null values properly; it raises
a TypeError because it expects a string or buffer. This became apparent
after the supplier info update which added columns that would be null
for existing packages. Patch returns None from the JSON deserializer
in that case, and also refactors unittest base classes.

Change-Id: I6f31500d2dd1aaaf6a1fd26c1901666072d79776
Closes-Bug: #1342306

commit_message:
xenapi: virt unrescue method now supports objects

Commit 65ad230af5ece020822fa963dd30fd641a54ae91 ensured
that the compute API and manager are now getting objects
for the unrescue method.

This patch adds support to the virt driver code.

python-ceilometerclient is missing. This patch adds it to the packages
to be installed in requirements.txt.

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 hosts API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
whole of Nova APIs.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: Ie252dce67f8e9d3292d8dad767b6113f7affcffd

commit_message:
Fix performance issues with brocade zone driver.

Removed firmware checks from common path as the ssh invoke_shell
was taking 5 seconds to complete for each firmware check.
Refactored to only do cfgsave in non-activate case.
Removed extra calls to switch to get the active zoneset.

Closes-Bug: #1292119

Change-Id: Ie1c2c0c603f6dd68439f2c2db74b21ea2dd0fc11

commit_message:
Fix wrong description for nova image-create

In the subsection "Create an image (nova)", there is a sentence said "You
cannot create a snapshot from an instance that has an attached volume",
which must be wrong. Currently, nova supports creating image from an
instance with attached volumes.

Change-Id: I811a845b8ee028ab83a12af03364930a0394e18d
Closes-Bug: #1341348

revisions:

The compute v2 API allows you to request a delete of

c7d2f020f0fdf04b24bd21668e7a02796f1f5538, so this

commit_message:
Remove 409 inProgressFault for deleteServer API

The compute v2 API allows you to request a delete of
a server while it's building since nova commit
c7d2f020f0fdf04b24bd21668e7a02796f1f5538, so this
change just updates the API docs.

that the compute API and manager are now getting objects

There are quite a number of use cases where we construct additional
datastore paths out of one representing some ancestor directory,
so implemented a join() method that allows for just that.
It is useful to define equality operator when comparing two DatstorePath
objects, so added that as well.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor
Change-Id: Iec44fdd0beba232b57bcd0a07c39e628208ca9b2
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: DatastorePath join() and __eq__()

There are quite a number of use cases where we construct additional
datastore paths out of one representing some ancestor directory,
so implemented a join() method that allows for just that.
It is useful to define equality operator when comparing two DatstorePath
objects, so added that as well.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor
Change-Id: Iec44fdd0beba232b57bcd0a07c39e628208ca9b2

commit_message:
Add 'Member' role to all created users

When cloud's glance service configured to use swift for storing data
then user works with glance must have operator_role.

Change-Id: Idd92640d5d6b1957aa6ac84a4124e0b2eb5f26b1
Closes-bug: #1316166

Change-Id: Id239a2eb42d8288764b8f374d5d13ebd37af5a7d

commit_message:
Introduce pragma no cover to asbtract classes

Since the unimplemented methods for abstract classes are not meant to be
actually used, they shouldn't be included in the code coverage
calculation. Thus, to address this I introduced the pragma "no cover" to
these classes.

Change-Id: Id239a2eb42d8288764b8f374d5d13ebd37af5a7d

commit_message:
Move keystone.token.default_expire_time to token.provider

Move the default_expire_time function from
keystone.token.core to keystone.token.provider. The function
keystone.token.core.default_expire_time is slated for removal
in the K cycle.

As part of the move to non-persistent tokens, the token_api calls
are being moved (as appropriate) to the token_provider_api in
preperation of token_api being deprecated.

Change-Id: Ic61e0dc13c7aabadbf75ae7aec30b30ce78d937b
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Move token_api.unique_id to token_provider_api

Move the unique_id call from token_api to token_provider_api and
mark token_api.unique_id as deprecated, slated for removal in
the K cycle.

As part of the move to non-persistent tokens, the token_api calls
are being moved (as appropriate) to the token_provider_api in
preperation of token_api being deprecated.

Change-Id: I7186b8af3ecc572ca364d58e2ba1a0303e48aca1
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Always create new dump of DB during upgrade

Upgrade script checks PostgreSQL dump and if
file exists it skips creation of new DB dump.
We need always create new dump file of DB and
use old ones only if dump creation fails.

Change-Id: I3eb4ed3de983dbbb0b9b932332fdc47b31ccc28e
Closes-bug: #1342112

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-07-14 16:19:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/ssh_actions/ssh_erase_nodes.rb', 'lib/astute/ssh_actions/ssh_hard_reboot.rb'], 'message': "Refactor ssh actions used for node erasing

Patch fixes few issues with erasing drives while
stopping deployment during provisioning, e.g.:
 * executing dd with non-existing under
   debootstrap shell option 'flag';
 * broken check of block device major code;
 * incorrect order of arguments, which are passed
   to erase_data function;
Also it implements more robust mechanizm to detect
provisining or provisined node.

Change-Id: Ic6022cc4ecb405a17dbeefb095590532cbbbe33b
Related-bug: #1316583
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor ssh actions used for node erasing

Patch fixes few issues with erasing drives while
stopping deployment during provisioning, e.g.:
 * executing dd with non-existing under
   debootstrap shell option 'flag';
 * broken check of block device major code;
 * incorrect order of arguments, which are passed
   to erase_data function;
Also it implements more robust mechanizm to detect
provisining or provisined node.

Change-Id: Ic6022cc4ecb405a17dbeefb095590532cbbbe33b
Related-bug: #1316583

subject: Fixes Hyper-V SCSI slot selection
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 3185, 'name': 'Alessandro Pilotti', 'email': 'apilotti@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'alexpilotti'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 8543, 'name': 'Lucian Petrut', 'email': 'lpetrut@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'plucian'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-15 21:13:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmutils.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/constants.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/volumeops.py'], 'message': "Fixes Hyper-V SCSI slot selection

Currently, when attaching volumes, the Hyper-V driver selects the
slot on the SCSI controller by using the number of drives
attached to that controller.

This leads to exceptions when detaching volumes having lower
numbered slots and then attaching a new volume, as Hyper-V will
then try to use an occupied slot.

This patch fixes the issue by simply getting a list of used slots
and getting a slot that it's not among those. It also checks
for the slot number to be smaller than the maximum number of slots
per SCSI controller.

Fixes bug: #1329764

Change-Id: Id0c09c4debc848004a78971670cc3caef2f77ce3
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V SCSI slot selection

Currently, when attaching volumes, the Hyper-V driver selects the
slot on the SCSI controller by using the number of drives
attached to that controller.

This leads to exceptions when detaching volumes having lower
numbered slots and then attaching a new volume, as Hyper-V will
then try to use an occupied slot.

This patch fixes the issue by simply getting a list of used slots
and getting a slot that it's not among those. It also checks
for the slot number to be smaller than the maximum number of slots
per SCSI controller.

Fixes bug: #1329764

Change-Id: Id0c09c4debc848004a78971670cc3caef2f77ce3

commit_message:
Mock out tunnel_sync in test to avoid sleeping

The tunnel_sync call in the daemon loop for the ovs tunnel
tests blocks for 30 seconds. This patch mocks it out to stop
that.

Closes-Bug: #1340570
Change-Id: I58c3907ed564413a8251bc1bb7922e25f673db18
